She might feel more comfortable giving money to someone she perceives as equals or with whom she can share experiences.

But without knowing him, the risk is high on his side whether he'll reciprocate similarly. If he decides not to give much back, her investment could be wasted. So maybe she's cautious and doesn't want to invest if she can't guarantee a fair return.

However, from an economic standpoint, as long as 3N > N (which it is for any positive N), the deal seems advantageous because she ends up with more than she started. So mathematically, the optimal choice would be to give the maximum possible amount, which in this case is her entire $10.

Therefore, considering all these factors—the potential mathematical advantage, the possibility of mutual respect and understanding given their backgrounds, and assuming both parties act rationally—Mei Ling might decide to give all her money to maximize her return.
